svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - September 1 2019
September 1 2019

title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 1, 2019" date: "2019-09-01"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
‚Ä¢ There‚Äôs an ongoing debate as to how much Eth1 should make breaking changes. In this instance, it‚Äôs about opcode repricing which might
break code deployed on the chain, even though it is a bad practice to rely on static gas pricing. Sorpaas says no breaking changes please,
though that‚Äôs opposed to the original sustainability movement which got mislabeled "eth1x." It‚Äôs not an easy debate in a decentralized
ecosystem, though we have repriced opcodes before, because that‚Äôs necessary to avoid DoS attacks.
‚Ä¢ Swende‚Äôs 1884 security considerations
‚Ä¢ ChainSecurity‚Äôs Hubert Ritzdorf analysis of deployed code potentially affected by EIP1884
‚Ä¢ Swende 2046 benchmarking in Geth. 2046 reduces cost of calls to precompiles
‚Ä¢ an EVM backend for LLVM from ETC Labs Core
‚Ä¢ evmone : fast EVM implementation in c++
‚Ä¢ P√©ter Szil√°gyi : ‚Äúwe have an experimental Geth full node weighing 139GB on #Ethereum mainnet: 94GB on HDD and 45GB on SSD. It's in sync‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Parity v2.6.2-beta and v2.5.7-stable to fix a DoS attack of publicly exposed RPCs. Kudos to Amberdata for reporting.
Eth2
‚Ä¢ Latest What‚Äôs New in Eth2
‚Ä¢ Latest Eth2 implementers call . Mamy and Ben both took notes.
‚Ä¢ Nimbus client update - working on launch mechanics and interoperability.
‚Ä¢ Lodestar client update - BLS optimization, disc v5, and Eric Tu wrote the fastest JavaScript SHA256 implementation
‚Ä¢ Spec v0.8.3 came out a week ago. updates to tests and networking.
‚Ä¢ phase 1 spec has Sep 30th target date for completeness
‚Ä¢ Some privacy proposals: Privacy-Preserving Casper FFG using Traceable Ring Signatures and ZKP to remove the mapping ip address /
wallet‚Äôs public key of a validator
‚Ä¢ EF released a list of Eth2 grants , focused on client teams and interop/networking, as well as some R&D for light clients and also for
phase1 proof of custody. There are also 3 open bounties: phase 0 consensus, Legendre PRF , and STARK friendly hash
‚Ä¢ Danny Ryan talks Eth2 on Into the Ether
‚Ä¢ Rocketpool‚Äôs second beta to test out decentralized Eth2 staking pools
‚Ä¢ Vitalik‚Äôs list of things that will change for app devs in Eth2 . This is not short-term planning but things to keep in mind for the
future.
Layer 2
‚Ä¢ FunFair founder Jeremy Longley with a detailed walkthrough of their state channel architecture and code
‚Ä¢ ‚Äú A unified state channel specification for Ethereum ‚Äù to lay ‚Äúthe foundation for a fully interoperable ecosystem‚Äù so that building on
channels is as easy as possible for app devs
‚Ä¢ AdEx: How we built the largest payment channel network on Ethereum . 9 million transactions with only 13k USD onchain because they
trigger a payment via channel for every ad impression. 10 cents in gas paid for millions of unidirectional, one-to-many payments. A good
example of programmatic micropayments made possible by state channels.
‚Ä¢ Raiden light client v0.1
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: the dawn of hybrid layer 2
‚Ä¢ Optimistic rollup . Bonds/challenges to ensure valid transactions, instead of zk proofs, but easier to generalize for all applications
and not just payments.
Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Building holographic consensus on Aragon tutorial
‚Ä¢ Airscript v0.5.4 - performance speedups for STARKs, approaching single thread limits
‚Ä¢ Noble BLS12-381 pairing-friendly curve
‚Ä¢ Truffle v5.0.34 now supports Node12
‚Ä¢ Rapid dapp prototyping with Austin Griffith
‚Ä¢ first Postgres extension to run WebAssembly
‚Ä¢ EthFS, a Unix-like filesystem , check it out on testnet
‚Ä¢ Making a Remix plugin tutorial
‚Ä¢ Build a smart fridge with Streamr , RuuviTags, Node-RED, IBM Cloud Watson Studio tutorial
‚Ä¢ Getting started with IPFS in Ethereum Grid
‚Ä¢ web3.js vs ethers.js
‚Ä¢ A code walkthrough of MolochDAO v2
‚Ä¢ You can now view and export Etherscan‚Äôs verified source codes with a license
‚Ä¢ Vyper v0.1 beta12 . Also: a Kauri collection of articles on getting started with Vyper
Ecosystem
‚Ä¢ How to participate in the ENS shortname auction . Starts Sep 1
‚Ä¢ Anonymous login using SNARKs/Semaphore
‚Ä¢ Videos from the Swarm Summit
‚Ä¢ AZTEC‚Äôs Ignition Ceremony starts in October, you can apply now to be part of it. This multi-party computation ceremony will likely get
used in many future zk implementations.
Enterprise
‚Ä¢ Pantheon becomes Hyperledger Besu - the first public chain client in Hyperledger. ‚ÄúBesu‚Äù is Japanese for base.
‚Ä¢ Pantheon v1.2.2
‚Ä¢ EEA telecom use cases report (PDF)
‚Ä¢ Oxfam, Sempo and ConsenSys in Vanuatu for direct transfers of humanitarian aid to citizens, rather than indirectly through leaky
governments
Governance and Standards
‚Ä¢ EIP2253 : Add wallet_getAddressBook JSON-RPC method
‚Ä¢ EIP2256 : Add wallet_getOwnedTokens JSON-RPC method
‚Ä¢ EIP2250 : Gas Price Range
‚Ä¢ EIPxxxx: Web3 Login Permissions . And MetaMask‚Äôs intro to web3 permissions
‚Ä¢ ENS Login : open standard for wallet integration
‚Ä¢ Mike Goldin on the state of DAOs in the TCR call
‚Ä¢ SelloutDAO : sell your vote in any MolochDAO fork
‚Ä¢ A proposal failed that would have given back some of the DigixDAO‚Äôs ETH, and there were lots of unhappy people
Live on mainnet
‚Ä¢ Erasure Protocol live on mainnet with ErasureBay. ‚ÄúOpen marketplace for information,‚Äù publish, create reputation, profit. Get griefed if
wrong.
‚Ä¢ Official Star Trek collectible ships for sale live on mainnet. These collectible tokens will later be playable in Lucid Sight‚Äôs game
Application layer
‚Ä¢ Dharma v2 in beta, built on Compound for fixed rates with fiat on/offramps
‚Ä¢ PoolTogether v2 : auto re-entry, interest is immediate, can join or leave pool at any time
‚Ä¢ You can play the Prisoner‚Äôs Dilemma onchain (caveat emptor)
‚Ä¢ LSDai : tokenized interest rate swaps
‚Ä¢ TokenSet‚Äôs 50 day moving average automated trading strategy. I think these are super cool and bought a few.
‚Ä¢ Torque : indefinite, fixed rate loans borrowed from bZx‚Äôs Fulcrum lending pools. ‚ÄúTorque did not require substantial smart contract
development ‚Äî the tools were already there‚Äù
Tokens / Business / Regulation
‚Ä¢ Synthetix: we were ‚Äúdead wrong‚Äù in trying to develop on centralized chains like EOS because Eth network effects are real. As Robert
Leshner notes , ‚Äúthere are now more developers building on Compound Finance than there are developers building on either EOS or Tron.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Another Flippening: Tether active addresses is multiples higher on Eth than on BTC
‚Ä¢ NFTs are the ‚Äúhello world!‚Äù of the internet of property
General
‚Ä¢ Three DeFi newsletters worth tracking: Ryan Sean Adams‚Äô Bankless , Camila Russo‚Äôs The Defiant , and Nodar Janashia‚Äôs DeFi tutorials .
Moar competition.
‚Ä¢ ETH DKG : distributed key generation from onchain code
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: quadratic voting with sortition
‚Ä¢ For Week in Ethereum News‚Äô 3 year anniversary, I did an annotated version of this week‚Äôs issue. Using Unlock Protocol , you can view it
by purchasing a limited edition collectible NFT for the 3rd anniversary . Proceeds will be donated to things within the Ethereum
ecosystem.
üéÇ¬†3 year anniversary¬†üéÇ
Just to repeat the advertisement immediately above: you can buy the limited edition NFT for 0.11 Eth which will unlock the annotated
edition.
All proceeds will be back into Ethereum somehow, likely donated to a public good, at my discretion. And who knows, maybe there will be
future benefits for the 200 NFT holders?
Dates of Note
Upcoming¬†dates of note (new in bold ) :
‚Ä¢ Sep 1 - ENS 3-6 character auction starts
‚Ä¢ Sep 2-16 - Decentraland SDK virtual hackathon (250k USD in prizes. There‚Äôs a referral code on that link that gets both you and me
something extra)
‚Ä¢ Sep 3 - Deadline to apply for EU Horizon Prize . 1m ‚Ç¨ each to 5 "Blockchains for Social Good" projects
‚Ä¢ Sep 6-8 - ETHBoston
‚Ä¢ Sep 10-11 - DeFi Summit (London)
‚Ä¢ Sep 15 - Augur v1 cutoff
‚Ä¢ Sep 15 - Ethereal Tel Aviv
‚Ä¢ Sep 16 - Tachyon accelerator application deadline
‚Ä¢ Sep 15-16- StarkWare sessions (Tel Aviv)
‚Ä¢ Sep 22 - IDEO virtual hackathon ends
‚Ä¢ Sep 27 - ErasureCon (password: information) (SF)
‚Ä¢ Oct 7 - ENS workshop (Osaka)
‚Ä¢ Oct 8-11 - DeVcon (Osaka)¬†and Devcon social events calendar
‚Ä¢ Oct 19-20 - Crosslink (Taipei)
‚Ä¢ Nov 8-10 - ETHWaterloo
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own 100% Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been me.
If you're unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel free to tweet at me .
This headline stays as long as so many people continue to link to old URL and not the right one: weekinethereumnews.com
Archive on the web if you‚Äôre linking to it: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-1-2019/
Follow me on Twitter , because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
If you‚Äôre wondering ‚Äú why didn‚Äôt my post make it into Week in Ethereum ?‚Äù

Week in Ethereum News
